response.answer_text: Yes. K-pop stands for Korean Pop (music). Of course, the idols don’t necessarily have to be Koreans. So what is a general K-pop group? →At least one Korean member →In modern day context, at least four members (though older groups have three members) →Produces mainly Korean music (doesn’t necessarily have to pop genre despite its name, idols can have songs in other languages)
Ofc, K-pop stands for ‘Korean pop music’. It’s a genre that is purely korean, but these days a few other countries like thailand, china have started forming bands similar to this genre.
